message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this great product! I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $110.
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $100. Would you be willing to sell it to me for that price?
I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob, but I have to make a living. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll sell it to you for $105.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit flexible. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $98?
I'm glad you're still interested in the product, Bob. I can see you're a serious buyer. I'm willing to come down a bit more, but I need to make a profit. I'll sell it to you for $102.50.
I appreciate your willingness to come down a bit, but I'm still looking for a better deal. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $95?
I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $97.50, but I'm not going any lower than that. This is as close to the minimum I'm willing to go.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $97.50, but I'm still looking for a better deal. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $92?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're not going to meet in the middle, Bob. I'm willing to give you a bit more, but I need to think about my bottom line. I'll sell it to you for $96, and that's as low as I'm willing to go.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $96, but I'm still looking for a better deal. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $90?
